alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 12 at 5:53PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Yukon River downstream of Eagle. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of the Yukon River near the Tatonduk and Seventymile rivers isoccuring with water surrounding several cabins. Ice jam flooding is possible in all areas along the Yukon River downstream of Eagle. Impacts could range between minor or severe flooding. Large chunks of ice may push overbank. Now is the time to take precautions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A large ice jam has now formed at Eagle as is causing flooding at Eagle. Several smaller jams have occured downstream at the Seventymile and Tatonduk rivers causing minor flooding there. When the ice jam at Eagle releases, it is possible additional ice jams and flooding could occur along the Yukon river downstream of Eagle. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc/ - If you live near or along Yukon River downstream of Eagle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor local river conditions and prepare for the possibility of ice jam flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Now is the time to move items to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
